channel.title: Webclient issue
channel.description:
Ok, so i've followed every tutorial on how to make a webclient. Basically, the jar works perfectly, it's just that when i try to run it online, it doesn't work... Here's my setup Sites -> ZymusScape.jar & cache is in here When i click on ZymusScape.jar, it loads fine, no "Error connecting to server", the signlink is told to look for the cache in the cache folder. Basically, i have everything in the right directory, and when i double click the jar normally, it loads fine. But when i try to load it on an html page, it just shows the java pic, and then goes to a red X in the corner. Any ideas on how to fix this? Here's pics: Folder With Jar and Cache [IMG]http://i44.photobucket.com/albums/f8/zyle269952/Picture3.png[/img] Cache folder [IMG]http://i44.photobucket.com/albums/f8/zyle269952/Picture4.png[/img] Jar File [IMG]http://i44.photobucket.com/albums/f8/zyle269952/Picture5.png[/img] Jar loaded fine [IMG]http://i44.photobucket.com/albums/f8/zyle269952/Picture6.png[/img] Webclient [IMG]http://i44.photobucket.com/albums/f8/zyle269952/Picture7.png[/img] Webclient Code [code] ~ Oraculum ~
[/code] EDIT: WTF? Got this from the Java Console
basic: Joined applet thread ... basic: Removed progress listener: sun.plugin.util.GrayBoxPainter@a7c484 basic: Referencing classloader: sun.plugin.ClassLoaderInfo@c19fbf, refcount=1 basic: Added progress listener: sun.plugin.util.GrayBoxPainter@aa17c3 basic: Loading applet ... basic: Initializing applet ... basic: Starting applet ... basic: Referencing classloader: sun.plugin.ClassLoaderInfo@c19fbf, refcount=2 basic: Releasing classloader: sun.plugin.ClassLoaderInfo@c19fbf, refcount=1 basic: Exception: java.lang.NumberFormatException: null
Why would there be a number format exception being thrown?

item.title: Webclient issue
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

No, the jar works fine, and my java is the highest it can be for a 10.4 mac.

Read full topic

item.description:
@system wrote:

you didnt place java in the right place, or the jar file is wrong

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient issue
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Ok, so i’ve followed every tutorial on how to make a webclient. Basically, the jar works perfectly, it’s just that when i try to run it online, it doesn’t work… Here’s my setup

Sites -> ZymusScape.jar & cache is in here

When i click on ZymusScape.jar, it loads fine, no “Error connecting to server”, the signlink is told to look for the cache in the cache folder.

Basically, i have everything in the right directory, and when i double click the jar normally, it loads fine. But when i try to load it on an html page, it just shows the java pic, and then goes to a red X in the corner. Any ideas on how to fix this?

Here’s pics:

Folder With Jar and Cache

Cache folder

Jar File

Jar loaded fine

Webclient

Webclient Code

<html>
	<head>
		<title>~ Oraculum ~</title>
	</head>
	
	<body>
		<center>
			<applet name="ZymusScape" width="765" height="503" archive="./ZymusScape.jar" code="client">
			</applet>
		</center>
	</body>
</html>

EDIT: WTF? Got this from the Java Console

basic: Joined applet thread ... basic: Removed progress listener: sun.plugin.util.GrayBoxPainter@a7c484 basic: Referencing classloader: sun.plugin.ClassLoaderInfo@c19fbf, refcount=1 basic: Added progress listener: sun.plugin.util.GrayBoxPainter@aa17c3 basic: Loading applet ... basic: Initializing applet ... basic: Starting applet ... basic: Referencing classloader: sun.plugin.ClassLoaderInfo@c19fbf, refcount=2 basic: Releasing classloader: sun.plugin.ClassLoaderInfo@c19fbf, refcount=1 basic: Exception: java.lang.NumberFormatException: null

Why would there be a number format exception being thrown?

Read full topic
